transcription.text: hello everyone welcome back to the
course of Raspberry Pi Pico so in this
video I'm gonna show you how you can
make weather station using Raspberry Pi
Pico and dst11 temperature and humidity
sensor so without wasting any time let's
restart it
[Applause]
so to make the project we need few
components like LC display few jumper
wires DHT 11 temperature humidity sensor
Raspberry Pi Pico and a breadboard
so now let us see the connections
[Music]
thank you
so according to a circuit diagram I
already built the connections so now let
us move to the coding part
now let us come to the coding section
for this project we require four files
which is dsd.5 files velocity API dot Pi
Pico i2clc dot pi and Main dot Pi so we
have to to work in the main dot Pi files
first of all uh I declare i2c equals to
i2c and LCD equals to i2c LCD these are
basically the i2c pins and the LC
display and then
we have to declare that t equals to
sensor dot temperature H equals to
sensor dot humidity and sensor we have
to declare as tstl11
pin which we are using as a temperature
humidity sensor
then we have to use all the uh
all this thing the time job sleep one
TLC dot clear I already explained this
uh syntax in the my previous video you
can go through that big video or I will
give the link of the video in the
description you can watch from there
so these are the one this is my code let
us run the code and upload to the Pico
board
so after uploading the code to my
Raspberry Pi Pico you can see that my
temperature currently showing is 33.2
degree celsius and humidity is
54.0 percentage so in this way you can
make a weather station using Raspberry
Pi Pico and dst11 temperature sensor so
now check whether my temperature is
showing showing is exactly matching to
my actual value or not
so
[Music]
so let us check
[Music]
today's temperature
[Music]
So currently
it is showing that the today's
temperature 34 degree Celsius
uh and it is showing that 33.1 degree
celsius it is almost uh it is a at least
one point uh 1.1 degrees difference of
1.1 degree Celsius
so there is no not much the difference
between the measured value and actual
value the measure value is my uh that
temperature reading on my LC display and
my actual value is this 34 degree
Celsius
so in this way you can make a weather
station using Raspberry Pi Pico
so if you like my video then please like
share and subscribe for more upcoming
videos
thank you
[Music]

transcription.text: hi welcome to donkey Tech in this video
I am going to show you how you can
interface with a dht22 aperture and
humidity sensor with your Raspberry Pi
we will use Python programming language
in doing the code for this project so I
have here my dht22 sensor module and my
Raspberry Pi's p0w together with the
breakout board and some connecting wires
what I'm going to show you is that I'll
be using the DHT 22 sensor module which
already contains the pull up resistor
and some filter capacitor but that there
there will be no need for us to connect
in external component in connecting with
our Niche t22 module so the dht-22
module outputs the temperature and the
humidity in a single data line and it
only has three pins one is for the power
in for the ground and BCC and the other
pin is the data line which is the data
line where in the temperature and the
humidity goes out for the wiring and
schematic all you need to do is just to
connect the three pins of your
22 module and just connect the ground
and the BCC pin to the ground and the
3.3 volts of our Raspberry Pi zero and
connect the data pin to the key of the
digital pins of the grassland pipe I'm
using the raspberry pi zero W here in my
project but you can use any other
Raspberry Pi variants such as the
Raspberry Pi 4B or the images which is
the Raspberry Pi zero two w
so let's go now into the code so the
code for this project by the way is
available in my GitHub repository which
I will post in the description of this
video and the way to connect with the
ht-22 sensor is by using the library so
when you try to Google for the library
that you can use when connecting with
the Raspberry Pi there's actually two
libraries that you would see one is the
adapro circuit python DHT Library so by
the way this is the latest project that
we can use or the latest library that we
can use and some of the sites when you
Google you will find them using the old
library which is the adapt python DHT
the only problem with this library is
that it is already deprecated so if ever
there is some issues with your readings
then it will be hard to use this Library
since the support is already ended for
this library but in our case in here I'm
going to show you how you you can use
bot libraries so that you can decide for
yourself which libraries that you're
going to use so the steps that I have
outlined here in my companion write-up
is already detailed so you just need to
follow the steps in here and just take a
look at how the library is being
installed so I have here the two
libraries which is the adapod circuit
python DHT and the other one is the
library called the adaproot DHT
so the only concern that I have with the
adapt circuit python is that the
installation is a bit involved and you
need to install the circuit python
library for the adapload project if you
are not familiar with the circuit python
it's the micro python implementation of
the adapload industries so once you have
installed the library by following the
steps in here then you can now start
connecting with your Raspberry Pi so
this is my project right now and if I
try to list the project you will see
that there is two file actually one is
named new and the other one is name all
so the new uh python file uses the new
circuit python library and the old is
using the deprecated Library which is
the adaproot python DHT Library
so but for now let's try to execute
these two these two files so that we
would know what the output is so to
execute the project just click type the
python and then the new
and as you can see because able to
retrieve the values of the temperature
and the humidity when you see this
message which is the pull buffer Let's
ignore this one it just means that the
library was not evil read the sensor
reading so you can just continue with
the code and as you can see the
temperature and humidity is being
returned if we try to hold the sensor
then you would see that the humidity
started going up right now so which
means that the sensor was able to detect
the change in the humidity
so that's all for the using the new DHT
simple so if we check what the code is
for this new the HD simple is it's
actually just really simple
what you need to do is just to import
the necessary packages or library and
then just create the DHT device which is
the dhc22 by the way this library is
applicable also for any DHT 11 variant
also so we just need to pass in the
board number or the gpio pin number
which is in my case is gpio 18.
and it just continually loops and after
looping it just reads the temperature by
passing in by calling the DHT device
that temperature and there is just some
conversion between the cell tell shoes
and the parent height and the humidity
is just being called by calling the DHT
device that immediately the error that
you have seen earlier was passed by some
runtime error here so it just prints the
error and then let's continue with the
looping so as per the DHT Library the
errors happens fairly often because it's
hard to read this answer so just ignore
it and just continue with the code so
that's is that's all for how you can
read the
they see 22 sensor using this Library
next I'm going to show you the old
Library which is the this one so let's
try running it first by planning python
all
and as you can see the library was able
to
get back also the value of the
temperature and the humidity so if we
try to check the code
so the only difference here is that it's
importing the adapter underscore DHT
with the first letter in capitalized
form
and then the sensor value is dictated as
the ht22 so you can replace it with the
dht11
then you just need to define the pins
and then after defining the pins there
is a complete Loop here just type it
check the method that is needed you see
that it is calling the read and retry
which is the sensor and then
which you can call by passing the sensor
and the paint and as you can see the
reason why it is redundant right such
that if there's a failure then it will
wait for two seconds before trying to
read again the hd22 sensor and then
after the values are retrieved then it
just prints the temperature and the
humidity
so basically that's really how easy it
is to read your hd22 sensor using the
crap root library and the Python
programming language so that's it I hope
you learned something happy exploring
[Music]
